chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Karen M Smaglick was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Karen M Smaglick appeared by video means with Attorney.  Matthew Ziegler, with WCS, in court.  Court first notes that there was a request to seal the defendant's address filed by Atty. Bailey.  Atty. Bailey presents statements.  Court notes that the Conditional release plan, which lists the address, is already sealed.  Court will also order that the defendant's address be sealed from public record in this case as well.  Court confirms with counsel that they have received and reviewed the conditional release plan. For reasons placed on the record the Court approves the conditional release plan as proposed in the report.  Court to prepare the order for placement.

Karen M Smaglick appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case called for review hearing on defendant's petition for conditional release.  Court reviews the findings in the reports on the record.  Court confirms counsel have received and reviewed the reports.  State is in agreement with the findings in the report allowing for conditional release.  Atty. Based on the agreement of the parties as well as the findings in the report the Court approves the petition for conditional release and will order that a conditional release plan be prepared.  Court will order that the report be filed by 3/18/2019.  Court will adjourn for review hearing regarding the conditional release plan recommendations. Defendant Karen M Smaglick in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The state calls Matthew Ziegler with WCS to testify.  The witness is sworn and the state conducts direct examination.  Cross examination of the witness by Attorney Bonneson. The witness is excused.  Attorney Will presents an argument to the court and requests institutional care.  Attorney Bonneson presents an argument to the court and requests the court grant the defendant conditional release. The court schedules the case for an oral ruling.  Oral ruling scheduled for April 23, 2018 at 02:45 pm.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Karen M Smaglick in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest by reason of mental disease or defect to Count 1.  Defendant makes statements.  Court finds the defendant guilty but not guilty due to mental disease/defect.  Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  Court accepts the report of Dr. Niesse.  Court orders a predepositional investigation be done by the Department under section 971.17(2), Wisconsin Statutes.  Report is to be filed with the Court by 1-26-18.  Either party can send to the court in writing by 2-2-18 if they are requesting another doctor to evaluate.  Sentencing/placement hearing scheduled for April 2, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
